publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3498 Chris Ballance: Ken Saro-Wiwa—That the Parliament notes that 10 November 2005 marks the 10th anniversary of the judicial murder of Nigerian writer, Ken Saro-Wiwa, and eight of his comrades by the then Nigerian military government; applauds the decision of the members of Scottish PEN to mark the occasion with a reading from Dance the Guns to Silence, a new international anthology of poetry commissioned in his memory, and joins PEN in condemning all acts of violence and repression of free speech against writers and their families.
S2M-3498 Ken Saro-Wiwa (lodged on 1 November 2005) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3498 Chris Ballance: Ken Saro-Wiwa—That the Parliament notes that 10 November 2005 marks the 10th anniversary of the judicial murder of Nigerian writer, Ken Saro-Wiwa, and eight of his comrades by the then Nigerian military government; applauds the decision of the members of Scottish PEN to mark the occasion with a reading from Dance the Guns to Silence, a new international anthology of poetry commissioned in his memory, and joins PEN in condemning all acts of violence and repression of free speech against writers and their families.Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Sarah Boyack*, Nora Radcliffe*, Robin Harper*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Bruce Crawford*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Rob Gibson*, Patrick Harvie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Bill Butler*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Eleanor Scott*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-3498 Ken Saro-Wiwa (lodged on 1 November 2005) Alex Neil*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-3498 Ken Saro-Wiwa (lodged on 1 November 2005) Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-3498 Ken Saro-Wiwa (lodged on 1 November 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3498 Ken Saro-Wiwa (lodged on 1 November 2005) Mike Pringle*
S2M-3498 Ken Saro-Wiwa (lodged on 1 November 2005) Shiona Baird*, Linda Fabiani*
